sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the New Vehicle Buyer Protection Act.
sections.text: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the New Vehicle Buyer Protection Act.

sections.heading: Definitions. For the purposes of this Act, the following words
sections.text: have the meanings ascribed to them in this Section.

sections.heading: Failure of vehicle to conform; remedies; presumptions.
sections.text: Failure of vehicle to conform; remedies; presumptions.

sections.heading: (a) The provisions of subsection (a) of Section 3 shall not
sections.text:
apply unless the consumer has first resorted to an informal settlement
procedure applicable to disputes to which that subsection would apply where

sections.heading: Persons electing to proceed and settle under this Act shall
sections.text:
be barred from a separate cause of action under the Uniform Commercial
Code.

sections.heading: Any action brought under this Act shall be commenced within
sections.text:
eighteen months following the date of original delivery of the motor vehicle
to the consumer.

sections.heading: The seller who sells a new vehicle to a consumer, shall, upon
sections.text:
delivery of that vehicle to the consumer, provide the consumer with a
written statement clearly and conspicuously setting forth in full detail
the consumer's rights under subsection (a) of Section 3, and the
presumptions created by subsection (b) of that Section.

sections.heading: This Act shall apply to motor vehicles beginning with the model
sections.text: year following the effective date of this Act.
